original: Anzelius, Adolf, professor, Göteborg, f. 29/4/94 i Växjö av köpm. Per A. o. Ida Lindenstein. — Stud:ex. i Växjö 12, KTH (maskinbyggn. o. mek. tek-nol.) 16, fil. kand. 18 o. fil. Uc. i Sthlm 20, fil. dr i Upps. 31. Assist, v. KTH 16, lär. v. Sthlms högsk. 21, doc. i teor. mek. v. KTH 31, lär. i matem. v. AIHS 39, i mek. v. KSHS 39, prof. i mek. o. matem. v. CTH sed. 45. LVVS. Skr.: avh. i matem. fysik o. teor. mek.
translated: Anzelius, Adolf, Professor, Gothenburg, born on April 29, 1894 in Växjö to merchant Per A. and Ida Lindenstein. He graduated from high school in Växjö in 1912, studied mechanical engineering and mechanical technology at KTH (The Royal Institute of Technology) in 1916, obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1918, and a PhD in 1931 from Uppsala University. He was an assistant at KTH in 1916, appointed as a lecturer at Stockholm University in 1921, a Docent in theoretical mechanics at KTH in 1931, a mathematics teacher at AIHS in 1939, and a mechanical teacher at KSHS in 1939. He became a professor of mechanics and mathematics at CTH in 1945. He has LVVS designation and has written dissertations on mathematical physics and theoretical mechanics.

structured.name: Adolf Anzelius
structured.description: Swedish professor specializing in theoretical mechanics, mathematical physics, and mechanical engineering.
